choices.D: An after insert trigger allows a developer to modify fields in the new record without a query.
choices.C: An after insert trigger allows a developer to make a callout to an external service.
choices.A: An after insert trigger allows a developer to bypass validation rules when updating fields on the new record.
choices.B: An after insert trigger allows a developer to insert other objects that reference the new record.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B Correct
We use before to operate on same object. If we want to access or modify other object than triggering object we use After.
I.e Fast field update = Before
I.e Related Records = After

Consider the following code snippet for a Visualforce page that is launched using a Custom Button on the Account detail page layout.

//IMG//


When the Save button is pressed the developer must perform a complex validation that involves multiple objects and, upon success, redirect the user to another Visualforce page.

What can the developer use to meet this business requirement?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Controller Extension allows you to extend the behavior of a standard controller (like Account here).You can write complex validation logic across multiple objects inside the extension class. You can also control what happens after save, including redirecting to another Visualforce page.
